hint.text:
Represent the volume of the cuboid as a product of its prime factors.
Remember, in the prime factorisation of a cube number, each factor appears thrice.

solution.text:
Volume of a cuboid = \(l \times b \times h\)
\(=15 \times 3 \times 3\)
\(=5 \times 3 \times 3 \times 3\)
Since the factor \(5\) appears only once in the prime factorisation, Oasis needs \(5 \times 5\) i.e. \(25\) such cuboids to make it a perfect cube.

content.text: Oasis is playing with lego blocks each in shape of a cuboid of size \(15cm \times 3cm \times 3cm\). How many such cuboids will he need to build a cube?
